intro: Scrophularia shulabadensis, commonly known as the Shulabad Scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the family. Scrophularia shulabadensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
